abstract: JPMorgan Chase shareholders narrowly approve compensation packages for chief executive Jamie Dimon and other top executives; 61 percent approval margin amounts to rebuke from investors over bank's pay package; Dimon will receive $20 million, the same amount he received in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Only 61 percent of votes cast at a shareholders meeting were in favor of the compensation planned for its top officials.

headline.main: Pay at JPMorgan Wins Slim Support of Shareholders
headline.print_headline: Pay at JPMorgan Wins Slim Support of Shareholders

snippet: Only 61 percent of votes cast at a shareholders meeting were in favor of the compensation planned for its top officials.
